svcproc.title: Exhaust Gas Recirculation (EGR) Valve
svcproc.para: The EGR valve, a variable position electromechanical valve, recirculates cooled exhaust gases into the intake air stream to reduce NOx emissions by reducing combustion temperatures.
The EGR valve changes valve position in response to private Controller Area Network (CAN) digital signals from the ECM.
The EGR valve has three major components: a dual poppet valve assembly, a DC motor, and an Integrated Circuit (IC). The IC has three Hall effect position sensors that monitor valve movement.
The EGR valve is installed in the EGR manifold on the top front of the engine.
